page.title: 17King's Sutton Street Names
page.content: The old streets were named because of what was in them: Church Lane by the Parish Church, Mill Lane, Bulls Lane and Wales Street; wales being an old word for wells. These roads are narrow and bendy. In the Council Housing area we can guess what the houses replaced: The Willows, Dairy Ground and Orchard Way. In the newest private housing estate the streets are named after palaces and castles: Windsor Close, Sandringham Road, Blenheim Rise, Balmoral Way, Hampton Drive etc. Perhaps the people selling the houses thought grand names made the houses seem bigger and the area a nicer place to live!
